title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 18 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 18.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:10, what is described as a strong tower?
options: The name of the LORD
The heart of man
The rich man's wealth
A man's gift
questions.correctAnswer: The name of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:10 states, 'The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:22 say about finding a wife?
options: A good thing and obtains favour of the LORD
A burden to bear
A cause of sorrow
A sign of weakness
questions.correctAnswer: A good thing and obtains favour of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:22 says, 'Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:2, what does a fool have no delight in?
options: Understanding
Gold
Power
Friends
questions.correctAnswer: Understanding
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:2 states, 'A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.'

questions.question: Complete the verse from Proverbs 18:21: 'Death and life are in the power of the ______.'
options: tongue
heart
hand
mouth
questions.correctAnswer: tongue
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:21 says, 'Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:11, what is compared to a strong city and a high wall?
options: The rich man's wealth
The righteous man's faith
The foolish man's pride
The wise man's knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: The rich man's wealth
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:11 states, 'The rich man's wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18:13 teaches that answering a matter before hearing it is wisdom.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:13 says, 'He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.' This means it is foolish, not wise.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:15 say the heart of the prudent and the ear of the wise seek?
options: Knowledge
Wealth
Power
Praise
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:15 says, 'The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:7, what is a fool's mouth described as?
options: His destruction
His treasure
His shield
His friend
questions.correctAnswer: His destruction
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:7 says, 'A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.'

questions.question: Who is called brother to the slothful in his work according to Proverbs 18:9?
options: A great waster
A wise man
A rich man
A righteous man
questions.correctAnswer: A great waster
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:9 states, 'He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18:24 says that a man with friends must show himself unfriendly.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:24 says, 'A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly,' contrary to the statement.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:8, the words of a talebearer are compared to what?
options: Wounds
Gold
Water
Fire
questions.correctAnswer: Wounds
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:8 states, 'The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:19 say is harder to be won than a strong city?
options: A brother offended
A wise man
A great treasure
A loyal friend
questions.correctAnswer: A brother offended
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:19 says, 'A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18:3 says that when the wicked cometh, contempt and reproach also come.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:3 states, 'When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:16, what effect does a man's gift have?
options: Maketh room for him and bringeth him before great men
Brings him sorrow
Causes him to lose favor
Leads to destruction
questions.correctAnswer: Maketh room for him and bringeth him before great men
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:16 says, 'A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 18:4 says, 'The words of a man's mouth are as ______ waters.'
options: deep
shallow
muddy
cold
questions.correctAnswer: deep
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:4 says, 'The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.'

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 18 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with pride before facing a difficult situation. Based on Proverbs 18, what biblical truth would you share about humility?
options: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity
A man's gift maketh room for him
The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters
questions.correctAnswer: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:12 teaches that pride precedes destruction, and humility comes before honor. This encourages believers to embrace humility especially in trials. Related verses: Proverbs 18:14 and Proverbs 18:15 emphasize inner strength and seeking knowledge humbly.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18 teach us about the power of words in daily life?
options: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof
A fool's lips enter into contention
The words of a talebearer are as wounds
The name of the LORD is a strong tower
questions.correctAnswer: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:21 clearly states the profound influence of speech, encouraging believers to use their words wisely. Supporting verses include Proverbs 18:6-7 on foolish speech and Proverbs 18:20 about satisfaction from the fruit of lips.

questions.question: A believer is facing conflict and is tempted to judge prematurely. What wisdom from Proverbs 18 would you share?
options: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him
The lot causeth contentions to cease
A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly
The rich man's wealth is his strong city
questions.correctAnswer: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:13 warns against answering before fully understanding, highlighting the importance of patience and listening. This aligns with humility (18:12) and seeking knowledge (18:15).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18 encourage believers to view the name of the LORD in times of trouble?
options: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe
The rich man's wealth is his strong city
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity
A man's gift maketh room for him
questions.correctAnswer: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:10 describes God's name as a refuge, teaching believers to trust in God's protection. This links to faith and perseverance in trials (18:14) and humility (18:12).

questions.question: Based on Proverbs 18, what advice would you give regarding friendships and social relationships?
options: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly
The words of a talebearer are as wounds
Death and life are in the power of the tongue
The lot causeth contentions to cease
questions.correctAnswer: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:24 emphasizes the need for active friendliness to maintain relationships. It also notes the value of faithful friends, highlighting love and reconciliation (18:19).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18 instruct us about diligence and work ethic?
options: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity
The rich man's wealth is his strong city
Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing
questions.correctAnswer: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:9 equates laziness with wastefulness, encouraging believers to work diligently as an act of stewardship and integrity. This is related to humility and seeking knowledge (18:15).

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18 teaches that a fool delights in gaining understanding.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:2 states that a fool has no delight in understanding but only in revealing his own heart, indicating folly rather than wisdom.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18 say about the consequences of careless or contentious speech?
options: A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes
The name of the LORD is a strong tower
The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge
A man's gift maketh room for him
questions.correctAnswer: A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:6 warns that foolish speech provokes strife and suffering, encouraging believers to speak with wisdom and self-control (18:21, 18:8).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18 describe the value of a gift or offering in social influence?
options: A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men
The poor useth intreaties
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity
The rich man's wealth is his strong city
questions.correctAnswer: A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:16 teaches that gifts or offerings can open doors and foster favor, indicating stewardship and generosity as part of godly living.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18, what is the difficulty in reconciling with an offended brother?
options: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city
The lot causeth contentions to cease
Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing
The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:19 illustrates the challenge of restoring broken relationships, emphasizing the need for patience, forgiveness, and love.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The words of a talebearer are as _____, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.'
options: wounds
waters
a snare
a strong tower
questions.correctAnswer: wounds
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:8 compares the harmful speech of a talebearer to wounds that deeply affect a person, warning against gossip and slander.

questions.question: A believer is feeling emotionally weak. According to Proverbs 18, what encouragement can you share about inner strength?
options: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
The name of the LORD is a strong tower
Before destruction the heart of man is haughty
Death and life are in the power of the tongue
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:14 acknowledges human weakness but emphasizes inner spiritual strength. This encourages prayer and reliance on God during trials.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18 advise us to approach wisdom and knowledge?
options: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge
A fool hath no delight in understanding
The rich man's wealth is his strong city
A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly
questions.correctAnswer: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:15 stresses the importance of actively pursuing wisdom and understanding, a key aspect of spiritual discipline and growth.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18 teaches that it is good to accept the person of the wicked and overthrow the righteous in judgment.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:5 clearly states it is not good to accept the person of the wicked or to pervert justice against the righteous, underscoring the importance of integrity.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18 say about finding a wife in terms of God's favor?
options: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD
A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly
The poor useth intreaties
The lot causeth contentions to cease
questions.correctAnswer: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:22 highlights marriage as a blessing and a source of divine favor, emphasizing the value of family and godly relationships.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 18.

questions.question: In Proverbs 18:10, what metaphor is used to describe the name of the LORD, and what does this imply about the protection it offers?
options: A strong tower providing safety for the righteous
A flowing river that nourishes the soul
A fiery furnace that refines the faithful
A root that sustains the tree of life
questions.correctAnswer: A strong tower providing safety for the righteous
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:10 states, 'The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe,' using the imagery of a fortress to symbolize divine protection.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18:21 emphasize the power of speech, and which New Testament teaching parallels this idea?
options: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; James 3 discusses the tongue's power
Silence is golden; Jesus teaches about quiet prayers in Matthew 6
Words are like seeds; Paul talks about sowing in Galatians 6
Speech is fleeting; Ecclesiastes reflects on vanity
questions.correctAnswer: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; James 3 discusses the tongue's power
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:21 teaches that 'Death and life are in the power of the tongue,' paralleling James 3, which extensively discusses the tongue's ability to bless or curse.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Proverbs 18:4 with 'deep waters' and 'flowing brook' to describe words and wisdom?
options: Metaphor highlighting depth and continuous flow
Simile comparing words to fire
Personification of wisdom as a woman
Alliteration emphasizing sound
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor highlighting depth and continuous flow
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:4 uses metaphor by likening words to 'deep waters' and wisdom to a 'flowing brook,' emphasizing depth and the ongoing availability of wisdom.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:12, what precedes destruction and what precedes honor, and how does this contrast reflect Hebrew wisdom literature themes?
options: Haughtiness precedes destruction; humility precedes honor
Pride precedes honor; humility precedes destruction
Ignorance precedes honor; knowledge precedes destruction
Wealth precedes destruction; poverty precedes honor
questions.correctAnswer: Haughtiness precedes destruction; humility precedes honor
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts arrogance leading to ruin with humility leading to honor, a common theme in Hebrew wisdom emphasizing the dangers of pride and the virtue of humility.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:22 state about finding a wife, and how is this connected to the theme of God's favor throughout Scripture?
options: Finding a wife is a good thing and obtains favor of the LORD
Finding a wife brings sorrow and testing
A wife is a burden to be borne
Marriage is a worldly distraction
questions.correctAnswer: Finding a wife is a good thing and obtains favor of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:22 affirms marriage as a blessing that brings divine favor, reflecting the biblical theme of covenant relationships as expressions of God's grace.

questions.question: In Proverbs 18:7, the fool's mouth is described using which metaphor, and what does this suggest about the consequences of foolish speech?
options: His mouth is his destruction and a snare to his soul
His words are like honey that sweeten the heart
His speech is a sword that defends him
His tongue is a river that refreshes
questions.correctAnswer: His mouth is his destruction and a snare to his soul
questions.explanation: The verse metaphorically describes foolish speech as self-destructive and trapping, highlighting the peril of careless words.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18:13 caution about answering before hearing, and how might this principle relate to judicial fairness in the ancient Near East?
options: Answering before hearing is folly and shame, undermining true justice
Quick answers demonstrate wisdom and decisiveness
Silence is preferred over any answer
Speaking first shows strength and authority
questions.correctAnswer: Answering before hearing is folly and shame, undermining true justice
questions.explanation: The verse warns against premature judgment, reflecting ancient Near Eastern legal principles valuing thorough hearing for just decisions.

questions.question: The phrase 'A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly' in Proverbs 18:24 highlights what social principle common in ancient cultures?
options: Reciprocity in friendship and community bonds
Isolation leads to strength
Friends are born, not made
Wealth secures lasting friendships
questions.correctAnswer: Reciprocity in friendship and community bonds
questions.explanation: This reflects the cultural expectation that friendships require mutual kindness and effort to flourish, important in communal Near Eastern societies.

questions.question: Proverbs 18:9 compares the slothful with what other type of person, and what does this reveal about the value of diligence in biblical thought?
options: A great waster, emphasizing the destructiveness of laziness
A wise builder, highlighting good stewardship
A joyful singer, showing the reward of effort
A humble servant, teaching patience
questions.correctAnswer: A great waster, emphasizing the destructiveness of laziness
questions.explanation: The verse equates laziness with wastefulness, underscoring diligence as a biblical virtue.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:17, what is revealed by the arrival of a neighbor in a dispute, and how does this relate to the concept of impartiality in ancient justice?
options: The first appears just, but the neighbor's inquiry reveals truth
The first is always right, the neighbor is biased
Neighbors should not get involved in disputes
The loudest party is usually correct
questions.correctAnswer: The first appears just, but the neighbor's inquiry reveals truth
questions.explanation: This highlights the need for hearing multiple sides to avoid partiality, a key principle in biblical and ancient Near Eastern justice.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'lot' in Proverbs 18:18 in resolving contentions, and how does this reflect broader ancient Near Eastern practices?
options: The lot causes contentions to cease by providing impartial decision-making
The lot is a form of divination condemned in Scripture
The lot increases disputes among the mighty
The lot is used only for religious festivals
questions.correctAnswer: The lot causes contentions to cease by providing impartial decision-making
questions.explanation: Casting lots was an accepted ancient practice to settle disputes fairly and is noted here as a means to end conflicts.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18:8 portrays the words of a talebearer as harmless gossip that only affects surface relationships.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:8 depicts the words of a talebearer as wounds that penetrate deeply, indicating serious harm beyond mere gossip.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 18:15 says, 'The heart of the prudent getteth _______, and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.'
options: knowledge
strength
wealth
honor
questions.correctAnswer: knowledge
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes the value placed on acquiring knowledge by prudent and wise individuals.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18:11 describe the rich man's wealth, and what does this reveal about the perceived security wealth provides in ancient culture?
options: As a strong city and high wall in his own conceit
As a fleeting shadow that vanishes
As a river that nourishes the poor
As a burden too heavy to bear
questions.correctAnswer: As a strong city and high wall in his own conceit
questions.explanation: The verse metaphorically relates wealth to fortifications, reflecting a belief in wealth as a form of protection and status.

questions.question: What is the implication of the phrase 'A fool hath no delight in understanding' in Proverbs 18:2 regarding the nature of folly in Hebrew thought?
options: Fools reject understanding because they prefer self-expression
Fools seek wisdom above all else
Fools are humble and open to correction
Fools are silent and contemplative
questions.correctAnswer: Fools reject understanding because they prefer self-expression
questions.explanation: The verse indicates that fools prioritize revealing their own heart rather than seeking understanding, highlighting self-centeredness as folly.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 18 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18, what is the consequence of a fool's speech?
options: His lips are the snare of his soul
His words bring peace
His speech is full of wisdom
His mouth delivers blessing
questions.correctAnswer: His lips are the snare of his soul
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:7 states that a fool's mouth is his destruction and his lips are the snare of his soul, highlighting the destructive power of foolish speech. This is consistent with James 3:6, which teaches that the tongue is a fire, and Psalm 141:3, which asks God to set a guard over the mouth. Proverbs 10:19 warns about excessive talk, and Ecclesiastes 5:2 advises careful speech.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:10 say about the name of the LORD?
options: It is a strong tower where the righteous find safety
It is a mysterious enigma
It is only known to the learned
It is a source of fear for the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: It is a strong tower where the righteous find safety
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:10 describes the LORD’s name as a strong tower, a place of safety for the righteous. This aligns with Psalm 18:2, which calls God a rock and fortress, 2 Samuel 22:3, and Nahum 1:7, which portray God as a refuge. Hebrews 6:18 also speaks of God’s unchanging promise as a strong hope.

questions.question: What attitude precedes destruction according to Proverbs 18:12?
options: Haughtiness of heart
Humility
Patience
Joyfulness
questions.correctAnswer: Haughtiness of heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:12 teaches that before destruction comes the haughtiness of heart, emphasizing the sin of pride. This is consistent with Proverbs 16:18, which states pride goes before a fall, Isaiah 2:12, and James 4:6, which speaks of God resisting the proud but giving grace to the humble. 1 Peter 5:5 also exhorts humility.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a ______ spirit who can bear?'
options: wounded
joyful
strong
quiet
questions.correctAnswer: wounded
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:14 contrasts the sustaining nature of the human spirit with the unbearable burden of a wounded spirit. This reflects biblical themes found in Psalm 34:18, which comforts the brokenhearted, Isaiah 61:1 about healing the brokenhearted, Matthew 11:28 offering rest to the weary, and 2 Corinthians 12:9 where God's power is perfected in weakness.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:21, what is in the power of the tongue?
options: Death and life
Joy and sorrow
Peace and conflict
Truth and falsehood
questions.correctAnswer: Death and life
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:21 teaches that death and life are in the power of the tongue, emphasizing the significant impact of words. This corresponds with James 3:5-6 on the tongue's power, Matthew 12:36-37 on accountability for words, Ephesians 4:29 encouraging edifying speech, and Colossians 4:6 advising gracious words.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:22 say about finding a wife?
options: It is a good thing and obtains favour of the LORD
It is a burden and leads to sorrow
It is insignificant in God's plan
It is a matter of chance
questions.correctAnswer: It is a good thing and obtains favour of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:22 affirms that finding a wife is a good thing and brings favor from the LORD, highlighting God's blessing on marriage. This is consistent with Genesis 2:18-24 on marriage creation, Ephesians 5:25-33 about Christ and the church, Song of Solomon's celebration of love, and Hebrews 13:4 which honors marriage.

questions.question: What is said about answering a matter before hearing it in Proverbs 18:13?
options: It is folly and shame
It is wisdom and prudence
It is courage and boldness
It is justice and fairness
questions.correctAnswer: It is folly and shame
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:13 warns that answering before hearing is folly and shame, emphasizing the value of listening. This aligns with Proverbs 1:5 on gaining understanding by listening, James 1:19’s exhortation to be quick to hear, Ecclesiastes 5:1 on careful speech, and Matthew 7:1 urging to judge rightly.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18:4 compare the words of a man's mouth?
options: They are as deep waters and a flowing brook of wisdom
They are like a dry desert
They are like scattered leaves
They are as a roaring lion
questions.correctAnswer: They are as deep waters and a flowing brook of wisdom
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:4 uses the metaphor of deep waters and a flowing brook to describe the depth and life-giving nature of wise speech. This is consistent with John 7:38 where Jesus speaks of living water, Isaiah 55:1 inviting thirsty to water, Revelation 22:1 describing the river of life, and Psalm 36:9 where God's presence is a fountain of life.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:9 say about slothfulness?
options: He that is slothful is brother to a great waster
Slothfulness leads to great wealth
Slothfulness is a sign of wisdom
Slothfulness is praised among the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: He that is slothful is brother to a great waster
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:9 equates slothfulness with being like a great waster, showing that laziness leads to destruction. This is echoed in Proverbs 24:30-34 warning about neglect, Ecclesiastes 10:18 on disorder from laziness, 2 Thessalonians 3:10 encouraging work, and Proverbs 12:24 praising the diligent.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 18:6, what do a fool's lips do?
options: Enter into contention and call for strokes
Bring healing and peace
Speak only truth
Offer wise counsel
questions.correctAnswer: Enter into contention and call for strokes
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:6 presents the fool’s lips as provoking quarrels and inviting punishment, consistent with Proverbs 15:1 on soft answers turning away wrath, Proverbs 29:11 on fools airing anger, James 3:14-16 on bitter envy, and Matthew 5:9 about peacemakers.

questions.question: What role does a man's gift play according to Proverbs 18:16?
options: It makes room for him and brings him before great men
It burdens him with responsibility
It causes envy and strife
It is insignificant in his advancement
questions.correctAnswer: It makes room for him and brings him before great men
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:16 teaches that a man's gift opens doors and provides access to influential people. This aligns with Acts 7:10 where Joseph’s gifts elevated him, Daniel 1:9 showing favor through gifts, Exodus 35:35 where God gifts skills, and 1 Corinthians 12:4-11 on spiritual gifts for service.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 18:19 describe a brother offended?
options: Harder to be won than a strong city
Easily reconciled
Indifferent to conflict
A source of joy
questions.correctAnswer: Harder to be won than a strong city
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:19 illustrates that an offended brother is difficult to reconcile, likening this to the challenge of capturing a strong city. This is supported by Matthew 18:15-17 on resolving offenses, Ephesians 4:26-27 about anger, Colossians 3:13 on forgiveness, and Romans 12:18 urging peace.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:5 say about accepting the person of the wicked in judgment?
options: It is not good and leads to overthrowing the righteous
It ensures justice and fairness
It brings peace to the community
It is the command of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: It is not good and leads to overthrowing the righteous
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:5 warns against partiality to the wicked, which results in injustice against the righteous. This aligns with Deuteronomy 1:17 condemning partial judgment, Exodus 23:3 against siding with the wicked, James 2:1-9 on impartiality, and Psalm 82:2-4 calling for defense of the poor and needy.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:24 say about friendship?
options: A man with friends must show himself friendly
Friendship is unimportant
Friends are a source of envy
True friends are easy to find
questions.correctAnswer: A man with friends must show himself friendly
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:24 highlights the necessity of being friendly to have friends and notes a friend who sticks closer than a brother. This corresponds with John 15:13 on friendship’s love, Ecclesiastes 4:9-10 on companionship, Romans 12:10 urging brotherly love, and 1 Corinthians 15:33 warning about bad company.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 18:17 say about being first in one’s own cause?
options: He seems just until the neighbor comes and searches him
He is always right
He is respected by all
He is condemned immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He seems just until the neighbor comes and searches him
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:17 teaches that a person who argues his own case first seems just, but the neighbor’s examination reveals the truth. This is consistent with Exodus 23:1-3 about not bearing false witness, John 7:24 calling for righteous judgment, Matthew 7:1-2 on judging rightly, and Proverbs 25:8 advising caution in disputes.
